result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Paul was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.

At least part time employment.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Court cost are waived.

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

supervisions.notes: If enrolls in sex offender treatment by 8/26/16 can be served on EM through JSS. If does well balance can be vacated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Paul
